H0.text: what two countries make up the dominican republic. Haiti and Cuba

H1.text: what two countries make up the dominican republic. Jamaica and Puerto Rico

H2.text: what two countries make up the dominican republic. Bahamas and Turks and Caicos

H3.text: what two countries make up the dominican republic. Hispaniola

A4.text: Hispaniola is divided into the sovereign countries of the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

A5.text: The Dominican Republic's economy is more than 1000% larger than Haiti's.

A6.text: The map shows Hispaniola and Puerto Rico as separate islands.

A7.text: The Dominican Republic shares a land border with Haiti to the west.

A8.text: To the north and north-west lie The Bahamas and the Turks and Caicos Islands.

A9.text: Haiti occupies the western side of the island, which it shares with the Dominican Republic.

A10.text: the Dominican Republic shares a 360-kilometer (224 mi) border with Haiti.
